snippet: As the search for the missing Malaysia Airlines jetliner spread out across an expanded area, China said that none of its nationals on Flight 370 were terrorists or malcontents who tried to seize the plane.
abstract: Chinese government says it has ruled out the possibility that any of the Chinese citizens aboard Malaysia Airlines flight 370, which disappeared over Pacific Ocean, were terrorists, separatists or malcontents who might have tried to hijack the flight.

byline.original: By CHRIS BUCKLEY and KEITH BRADSHER
byline.contributor: Michelle Innis contributed reporting from Sydney, Australia, and Edward Wong from Beijing. Bree Feng contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: As the search for the missing Malaysia Airlines jetliner spread out across an expanded area, China said that none of its nationals on Flight 370 were terrorists or malcontents who tried to seize the plane.

headline.main: China Rules Out Terror Ties Among Citizens on Jet
headline.print_headline: China Rules Out Terror Ties Among Citizens on Jet
